Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the IAD make an unreasonable decision by failing to properly assess evidence and ignoring relevant factors?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Sidhu spent only 26 days in Canada over five years.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: IAD allowed appeal based on humanitarian and compassionate grounds.
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review to challenge IAD's decision
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Federal Court found the decision unreasonable
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident appealing residency obligation enforcement
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Prolonged absence from Canada with minimal physical presence
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds, including family ties and hardship
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied in judicial review
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Family ties, hardship, credibility of explanation for absence
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 28 and Section 67
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure by IAD to address all evidence and provide coherent reasoning
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: IAD ignored inconsistencies and lack of corroborating evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Testimony regarding family obligations in India, business activities
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations despite failure to meet residency requirement
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Limited; key contradictions not adequately addressed
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Retention of permanent resident status via H&C relief
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Permanent residents must be physically present in Canada for at least 730 days in a five-year period
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of supporting documentation for claimed hardships and activities abroad
Crimes.Outcome: Decision set aside, case remitted for redetermination
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential loss of permanent resident status due to non-compliance
Crimes.Cause_Description: Sidhu failed to meet residency requirements but appealed based on humanitarian grounds
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: IAD failed to properly analyze or reconcile conflicting evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 28 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Unexplained inconsistencies in testimony and lack of corroboration
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Only 26 days in Canada over five years – gross non-compliance
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: IAD emphasized family ties and hardship but overlooked evidentiary gaps
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to address contradictions in Sidhu’s account

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to meet residency obligations under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Board err in granting humanitarian and compassionate relief despite insufficient evidence?
Crimes.Decision_Level: Administrative (IAD) decision subject to judicial review
Crimes.Outcome: Board's decision set aside and remitted for reassessment
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal from negative determination on residency compliance
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Contradictory evidence about business and family situation undermined credibility
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, claims of family obligations in India
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds due to family circumstances
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Extent of physical presence, strength of humanitarian claims
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: IAD appeal followed by Federal Court judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to consider all relevant evidence and resolve inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Contradictory information about Sidhu’s business operations and family life abroad
Crimes.Application_Factor: Duration of absence, justification for non-residency
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Initial approval overturned on judicial review
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the IAD reasonably assessed humanitarian claims
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Section 28 requires 730 days of physical presence
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for new hearing before different IAD panel
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inadequate justification and flawed evidentiary assessment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration and internal inconsistencies in claimant’s narrative
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Concerns about thoroughness and transparency in IAD analysis
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Significant discrepancies in explanations for prolonged absence
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Humanitarian and compassionate relief under Section 67
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and administrative review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Incomplete reasoning and failure to engage with contradictory evidence
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to assess credibility and corroborate claims
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Failure to meet residency obligation under Section 28
